alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 8:51AM CDT until June 14 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT FOR PHILLIPS...CENTRAL COAHOMA AND SOUTHWESTERN TUNICA COUNTIES... At 851 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near St. Charles, or 9 miles north of White River National Wildlife Refuge, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Marvell, Elaine, Helena-West Helena, White River National Wildlife Refuge, Friars Point, Kings, Sherard, Crumrod, Watkins Corner, Lake View, Rena Lara, Mosby Spur, Ferguson, Wabash, Modoc, Preston Place, Quarles, Hoop Spur, Westover and Jeffries. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
